data.title: Always aTreat
data.text: La Isla has become our fun weekend do something special spot. Moderately priced but oh so good. Their sandwiches are great and their Mofungo is the best I have had outside of Puerto Rico. Ask for a side of their mojito (garlic) sauce you wont be sorry

data.title: Wonderful Puerto Rican samples
data.text: Our group went to happy hour at La Isla and found it a superb way to sample local foods and drinks.  I especially fell in love with the liquor from Brazil, Cachaca and the drink called Caipirinha is my new favorite.  Service was excellent!!  The ambiance was nice for the occasion.

data.title: Great for lunch or dinner
data.text:
I visited here with a girlfriend for lunch and enjoyed it so much I came back a week later for happy hour/dinner with my husband and another couple. We are heading to Puerto Rico in about 10 days and wanted to start getting in the mood. 

I really like the food and find it to be as good or better than a lot of what I find in Puerto Rico. So fun to have green and ripe plantains as a side dish! 

I had pulled pork for lunch and I liked it with the sauces they provided. Enough food for two meals! My girlfriend had the chicken stew and it was really good as well.

For dinner I tried the casserole with pulled pork and plantain. Really a clever way to present it. I really like their garlic sauce treat is served with the plantains. 

My friend fell in love with the Brazilian drink, I enjoyed my Guavarita. 

The only thing I would say is that I prefer the dishes with a little more spice, so I end up adding the sauces. But it is good to allow customers to do that for themselves I suppose.

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
first impression lousy, waiter chose for us a small booth, wooden benches, near noisy customers, not near several windows booths that were empty.  It was almost as if they
didn't want to walk too far from the kitchen.  We moved to a quieter, bigger table, near a window.  My choice of pulled pork was delivered luke warm, minimal sauces in  a tiny
metal cup on the side of the plate with rice and beans on the side with a small selection 
of dried lettuce leaves pushed onto the plate. I didn't expect Barking Frog, but come on, this barely makes OK.  Noise level annoying, too.  I won't go back.

data.title: Puerto Rican food, near the Microsoft Campus
data.text: Pretty authentic menu, very rustic preparation. Found the food good value and filling. I would not opt for a rice dish next time, but the grill was nice.

data.title: Puerto Rican in Washington!
data.text: Having been to Puerto Rico I can say that there are several items on this menu that are authentic. Good atmosphere, good food. You must try the pistachio tres leches cake for dessert.

data.title: Great Eats and Ice Cold Beer
data.text: The atmosphere is quite nice with lots of room. The food and the service was exceptional. I have to say it was not very busy when I visited. I am told happy hour is packed. I am guessing because the ice cold beer and good selection.

data.title: Early dinner
data.text: Sunday afternoon early dinner, got a table straight away. Mojitos were nice, food was a good price and a great size. Everything we ordered was delicious. The seats were a little uncomfortable.

data.title: Great food and mojitos
data.text: Went for some dinner with a big group of people.  We got a table very quick.  The mojitos were amazing and also the food,  specially the mofongo.  No one could finish the plate!  Very generous!  Totally recommended place

data.title: Dinner (before movie) was great
data.text: I went here for the first time last weekend with friends, after buying tickets to a movie at the nearby theater. Every one of us enjoyed our meals. The portions were exactly right to satisfy our appetites without making us feel like we overate. I thought the prices were a bit high for a place like this.

data.title: Puerto Rican food in Downtown Redmond!
data.text: Puerto Rican food in Downtown Redmond!  They have 2 locations, the other in the Ballard neighborhood of Seattle. I believe that branch is the original. The salmon dishes are good.

data.title: Central American food as Authentic as it gets away from Central America
data.text: The food here is excellent and considering that plantains are not usually available this far north the ingredients are also very authentic as well as delicious.  I sat outside with the sun shining and a gentle breeze. I highly recommend La Isla!

data.title: Great Puerto Rican place for a quick late night dinner
data.text: This is one of our favorite late night dinner places. They are open very late, have a great bar that will hand make lemonade for me (rather than using a powder mix) and a good selection of food. It's good for those who need gluten free, but not necessarily safe for those who need dairy free.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: We have never tried Puerto Rican food so we have nothing to compare it with but this place served up some absolutely scrumptious food. I had the Empanadillas with pulled pork and Bacalaitos and it was all delicious! My husband had the Salmon La Isla and he was raving about his meal as well. It's unfortunate that we were traveling and do not have a La Isla near our home because if we did we would be dining there frequently. Loved it!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: A favorite!  Can never decide between the pulled pork or beef. Go with someone who shares!  Love the plantains!  Excellent bar.

data.title: like being in the caribean
data.text: very reasonable priced very unique food. Waiters were knowledgeable and gave great recommendations.  Plate generous and well priced.  Very tasty food and drink of the Caribbean variety.

data.title: Amazing as always
data.text: Amazing food and service. Usually visit 3-4 times per month. The food and drinks are just like Puerto Rico. Staff is friendly and prompt

data.title: Great Pulled Pork
data.text: Our first meal at La Isla. The pulled pork was delicious - tender and perfectly seasoned. Service was adequate and we enjoyed sitting on the outside patio. Good value meal.

data.title: Yum!  Authentic & delicious!
data.text:
I first went to La Isla about two months ago with a Puerto Rican friend who raved about how good and authentic it is.  It was so good I've now been back twice with two other groups of friends and we have all agreed, we loved it.  Meals are great but I could really make a meal of the appetizers.  In each case we ordered a lot because we wanted to try a little bit of everything.  My favorites are the papa & pernil empadadillas (sp?) and the guandules dip.  I'm not gluten-free but I'm guessing this place might be a good choice for those who are gluten-free because they use a a lot of plantains instead of bread (but not always).  For example, I had a pulled pork (pernil) sandwhich which used two big sheets of fried plantains instead of bread (it was a special but each time I've been there it was one of the specials).  
Casual atmosphere.  Reservations probably not necessary.

data.title: Great. Service and yummy food
data.text: My husband and I went for a late lunch early supper the waitress made great recommendations and also helped with wine selection. We each tried a pork sandwich and the wine was great.
